newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -T-bonds to find bolthole at 110-09,08.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -T-bonds to find bolthole at 110-09,08.

text.p: September T-bond futures will find solid support around the 110-09,08 area on Thursday from any storms caused by U.S. retail sales data later this session, technical analysts said.
But the recent upmove was looking strained.
"We are at the mature end of this move but there may be 1-1/2 to two points on the upside," said Norman Beauchamp, head of derivates at Cooperative Bank in London.
T-bonds were at 110-18 at 0954 GMT, down 1/32.
Analysts said initial support came in at at 110-12, the low on June 10 and so far this session but 110-09,08 was key.
The 110-09 level came from the top of the previous range on May 13 while the top of the channel drawn off the December and February highs came in at 110-08, Beauchamp said.
"On June 6 we broke out of the top of the channel and got to the 111-09 area and we've come back to test it," Beauchamp said. "Now we need to push ahead from here."
Beauchamp said the first target would be the 111-09 high. Beyond there, the 112-16 area would come into play. That level was a high on February 20, just near the February peak.
Stavros Loizou, manager strategic trading at Fuji Bank in London, put support below 110-08 at 109-27.
"Below that the market is going to target 109-15," he said. On daily charts 109-27 was the high on May 21, while 109-15 was the low last Friday from where the contract rallied.
September Eurodollars were quoted at 94.025, down 0.005 while December were at 93.810, down 0.005.

U.S. May retail sales at 0830 GMT were forecast to show a rise of 0.4 percent in the month after a 0.3 percent decline in April, according to a survey by Reuters. Excluding autos, sales were seen up 0.3 percent versus a 0.1 percent drop.
